front.p: 1897 November 8: to Hector Museum of New Zealand—Te Papa Tongarewa MU000095/012/0032

body.p: A few days ago I received from an old settler near Norsewood a mineralogical specimen which I send to you with this:—I suppose it to be red hematite. He wishes to know something about it, and it is likely I could obtain for you larger specimens if necessary.

I hope you are quite well: I am well as to general health, though right hand & arm not yet fully recovered (perhaps never may), and legs still weak for walking, not yet able to walk down my hill to town. With kind regards
